name: Yangshuo Moon Resort

reviews.text: I can't believe the changes in Yangshuo since I first came here in 1982 when Yangshuo was just a transit point following the river trip from Guilin. Every time I came back, the countryside was just as beautiful but the little town has grown and every place I stayed was like staying in a big city. This time I am stayed at Moon Resort (actually more of a small hotel) that overlooks rice fields and the mountains, but is near the main road into Yangshuo. It is also close to the Buddha caves (one time was enough) and Moon Hill that I have climbed on every visit.
reviews.title: Beautiful and quiet at a great price

likes.liked: — Good value in beautiful, strategic location.

reviews.title: A simple Hotel lost in a magnificient place
reviews.text: I stayed for four nights in an air conditioned room with a great view. I ate at the hotel twice and was surprise how good the food was for such a small establishment.
Excellent place to stay. Very clean, well maintained and genuinely friendly.
reviews.title: A fantastic gateway to Yangshuo

likes.liked: — The friendly staff, the view, the food, the environment
likes.disliked: — Something to mop the floor in the bathroom after shower would be useful ;-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for marble bathroom and ostentatious luxury, this is not your place.
reviews.title: The place to stay!

reviews.text: But if you are looking for a great gateway to Yangshuo, authentic local food and fantastic tips about what to do: go. Don’t hesitate for a nanosecond.
reviews.title: What a great deal!

reviews.text: Wei Wei is a golden heart: helpful, friendly, always doing her utmost to make your stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Outstanding value, great location

likes.disliked: — Hard to find on first encounter, but most Yangshuo taxi drivers know the way. No elevator. No closets.

reviews.text: She constantly gave us great tips, helped arranging transportation and organize our day when needed.
reviews.title: Moon Resort - Unique Experience, great hosts, a highlight of

likes.liked: — The total experience - everything! Wonderful hosts, great scenery, exciting activities, great food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel 3 nights. It was just after new year and really cold. Hotel did not have enough heating system. But I could just forget about coldness. Wei Wei and her husband were really nice couple. I have never stayed a hotel which is so welcoming. They were really helpful and kind. If I am going to Yangshuo again, I will surely stay there, even during winter. If you go out during night, they will rent you a touch( of course free), they will let you use washing machine for free, whenever we are in trouble with a taxi driver, we just called weiwei and she was happy to help, etc.( They have a pc in the living room.)
reviews.title: lovely people. highly recommended

reviews.text: I really can't say enough about this little gem of a hotel/resort. Wei Wei and her husband Derrick are great hosts,they make you feel completely at home and work very hard to make sure you get the most out of your stay with them. The price of the hotel was a great deal in my eyes. The place was clean,the food was good and the beer cold!.The location is one that works very well for touring around the area,the public transportation is easy to get to and Wei Wei is really helpful in pointing you in the right direction for all you outings. She set up transportation for us to the rice terraces,the driver stayed all day and met us on the other side of the hills. The other guests were all like minded and we had a good time with all.
reviews.title: great deal on a wonderful little hotel

reviews.text: This is a great small hotel, in the niche between a backpackers' place and a small inn. The food is excellent, and Wei Wei, the owner, is a terrific hardworking host and source of info. Because it is not in town, it provides a nice quiet place to stay, and getting to town is very easy.
reviews.title: All Pros and No Cons

reviews.text: We had a mountain-view room that had a full size bed and a twin size bed, two patio-style chairs, a TV (Chinese stations only), coat rack, and night stand. The large picture window made the room very light and airy, and the room was not cramped. The bathroom was the Asian-style combined shower and bathroom, but was large enough that you would not get the sink or towels wet while showering. Soap and shampoo were provided; no hair dryer. The room and hotel were clean and well-kept, although there is the occasional cracked tile, etc. The floors were regularly swept and mopped during the day. The hotel is down a small alley in a little rustic village, so you will hear the roosters crow in the morning, but it is otherwise very quiet. As you walk to the hotel, you'll pass some homes with outhouses and animals, so you might catch some smells, but that is part of the experience. There is no wireless, but they have a PC in the lobby that you can use for free. There is a ping-pong table next to the outdoor dining area that provided a good diversion, and makes this hotel kid-friendly.
reviews.title: Perfect Gem of a Hotel in Yangshuo (Moon Hill Village)!

reviews.text: One of the best things about this hotel is the food. For breakfast (not included in the room rate, but only 15-20 RMB ), you can have noodles and dumplings; hashbrowns and eggs; or a huge meal of eggs, toast, banana pancake, and yoghurt with muesli. All come with tea/coffee and fresh-squeezed juice. There is a full dinner menu with local and western choices. The beer fish local specialty (slightly spicy fish with tomato and peppers) is a must-try; better here than elsewhere. You should plan a little extra time for the meal since Wei Wei and her husband do all the work themselves, and if the inn is full, they are busy.
reviews.title: Great hotel, friendly, small, in rural area and the best for kids.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I cannot say one bad thing about Moon Hill Resort! We had such a wonderful stay
reviews.title: The place to stay in Yangshuo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the location: amazing view from the room, in a quiet village (Gao Tian) located just in front of the Moon Hill, near the water caves (but very expensive for what it is!) and 10 min taxi from Yangshuo city center (30 yuan), or minivan (2,5yuan/pers but stops around 7pm), or 30 min by bike.
reviews.title: quiet and clean country home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then the hotel itself: great value for money 80 RMB for a sparkling clean room, A/C, good bathroom with hot shower. Delicious food from the restaurant, much better than what we could have tasted dowtown in West street and much cheaper!
reviews.title: The Best Experience In China!

likes.liked: — Peace and uiet and friendly hosts

reviews.title: Great time in Yangshuo
reviews.text: last but not least: the hospitability of the owners. One of the nicest people we have met in China. Weiwei for example guided us through the countryside on bicycles because it was a national holiday and she had nothing to do! They have also invited us to share a family meal with them on that day where we could taste the local dish, beer fish. Their 3 year-old daughter is adorable as well and kept us company for some meals...
I could go on praising them but my memory is flaking right now!
reviews.title: Great little hotel with warm and friendly staff

likes.liked: — Location, friendly and helpful staff, air conditioning
likes.disliked: — Bathroom gets all wet from shower.

description: Moon Resort family hotel is the best place in MoonHill Village to enjoy YangShuo's Countryside. Between Karst peaks and rice paddies, our 15 comfortable rooms will offers you all the modern amenities (air-conditioning, private hot shower) plus a unique view on Chinese farmer's life. Our restaurant offers local and western meal and breakfast. Other facilities includes a lush covered courtyard, a laundry and internet access.
